title: Chicken Saag Recipe
description: Chicken saag is a classic Indian dish made with chicken, fresh spinach, and an array of spices. Sour cream makes this dish rich and creamy.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Indian Chicken Saag 4.5 (86) 66 Reviews 19 Photos Chicken saag is a classic Indian dish made with chicken, spinach, spices, and sour cream. Serve with basmati rice. Submitted by Joe Ortiz Updated on July 28, 2022 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 19 19 19 19 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 15 mins Total Time: 1 hr 45 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings ¼ cup vegetable oil 1 (3 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces 2 pounds fresh spinach, rinsed and chopped ¼ cup water 2 large onions, minced 5 cloves garlic, minced 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger root, minced 1 (14.5 ounce) can crushed tomatoes 1 teaspoon ground coriander 1 teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or more to taste ½ teaspoon ground turmeric 2 cardamom pods 2 whole cloves 1 tablespoon water, if needed ¼ cup milk 1 teaspoon garam masala 6 tablespoons sour cream 2 tablespoons butter Directions Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat; add chicken pieces and cook until browned, about 8 minutes per side. Set chicken aside. Place spinach into a large pot with 1/4 cup of water; bring to a boil, cover, and remove from heat. Allow spinach to steam for about 10 minutes; transfer into a blender and pulse until very finely chopped. Set spinach aside. Place onions, garlic, and ginger into the skillet; fry over medium heat, stirring frequently, until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Pour in tomatoes, ground coriander, salt, cayenne pepper, turmeric, cardamom, and cloves; stir in 1 tablespoon water, and cook, stirring frequently, for 10 minutes. Pour in milk and stir to combine. Add browned chicken pieces; bring to a simmer, reduce heat, cover, and simmer until chicken is tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in spinach and garam masala; cook until spinach starts to stick to the skillet, about 15 minutes. Stir in sour cream and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat and stir in butter. I Made It Print 169 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Chicken Saag 01 of 19 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 19 Photo by  Cindy West 02/17/2021 Delicious! Made as written. No modifications. 03 of 19 Photo by  Cindy West 02/17/2021 Delicious! Made as written. No modifications. 04 of 19 Photo by  Cindy West 02/17/2021 Delicious! Made as written. No modifications. 05 of 19 Photo by  ski_addict78 04/27/2020 This was so good! I made the recipe as written except I rounded my teaspoons as other suggested. Next time I will use chicken breast chunks as personal preference. It would also be delicious with chickpeas as another did for a vegetarian option. The sauce is so good. 06 of 19 Photo by  Shreyas 10/13/2019 07 of 19 Photo by  Ryan 03/11/2019 Good high quality recipe. For a fairly healthy dish, this is good stuff. 08 of 19 Photo by  Armenicus 12/08/2018 09 of 19 Photo by  Kristen Pothier 01/22/2018 10 of 19 Photo by  Allrecipes Magazine 02/06/2017 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Indian Tomato Chicken 323 Ratings Instant Pot® Butter Chicken from Frozen 4 Ratings Rosy's Palak Paneer 70 Ratings Makhani Murgh (Butter Chicken) 7 Ratings Indian Chicken Saag 2 Ratings Methi Murgh (Fenugreek Chicken) 5 Ratings Indian Chicken Curry (Murgh Kari) 1,275 Ratings Country Captain Chicken with Rice 4 Ratings Lasooni Murgh (Garlic Flavored Spicy Chicken) 12 Ratings Chicken Chicken Curry 34 Ratings Cilantro Chutney Chicken 16 Ratings Kadai Chicken 3 Ratings Masala-Spiced Roast Chicken 39 Ratings Cod Curry 147 Ratings Hara Masala Murgh 3 Ratings Traditional Chicken Curry 34 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Joe Ortiz
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat; add chicken pieces and cook until browned, about 8 minutes per side. Set chicken aside.;Place spinach into a large pot with 1/4 cup of water; bring to a boil, cover, and remove from heat. Allow spinach to steam for about 10 minutes; transfer into a blender and pulse until very finely chopped. Set spinach aside.;Place onions, garlic, and ginger into the skillet; fry over medium heat, stirring frequently, until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Pour in tomatoes, ground coriander, salt, cayenne pepper, turmeric, cardamom, and cloves; stir in 1 tablespoon water, and cook, stirring frequently, for 10 minutes.;Pour in milk and stir to combine. Add browned chicken pieces; bring to a simmer, reduce heat, cover, and simmer until chicken is tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in spinach and garam masala; cook until spinach starts to stick to the skillet, about 15 minutes.;Stir in sour cream and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat and stir in butter.
